case_vignette: A 21-year-old woman presents to the emergency room with right arm pain and limited range of motion. She does not recall trauma to the arm. She also complains of diarrhea and nausea. She is sexually active with one male partner and admits to having pain during intercourse. There is vague and diffuse tenderness to palpation in all four abdominal quadrants. No erythema or edema is noted on the right arm. The fecal occult test is negative. Past records show that this patient has been in the ER 7 times in the past year with similar symptoms.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

I have right arm pain and difficulty moving it, diarrhea, nausea, and pain during intercourse.
Thank you for sharing your symptoms with me. Can you tell me your age and gender?

Great, thank you for letting me know. Based on your symptoms, I would like to ask you some questions to help narrow down the possible causes of your right arm pain and difficulty moving it, diarrhea, nausea, and pain during intercourse.

Can you tell me when did these symptoms start occurring and have you noticed any patterns or triggers? For example, do they occur after certain activities, at specific times of the day, or after eating certain foods?
